intro: Dipcadi hysudricum, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive buttercup-like appearance. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has strap-like leaves that are often blue-green in color. It produces small, rounded seed capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
